My field is game theory on (mostly) No Limit Texas Hold'em Poker. I study exploitive and GTO(game theory optimal) strategies. When I've read the selifsh gene it was shocking to me, that nature plays the same way as I try to. When we consider any game (chess, poker, rock/paper/scrissors) and somebody has a big leak in his strategy, we should approach by an exploitive style and try to maximalize our expected value (imagine somebody always shows rock, you can win every time by showing only paper), but when the opponents are better and know about that, they can re-exploit by not doing what we assume they doing, and eventually we have to play some sort of GTO (unbeatable) strategy instead of readjusting all the time. If in a game everybody plays GTO, then it become Nash Equilibrium and nobody can gain any value on the other.
(showing rock, paper, scrissors exactly 1/3, 1/3, 1/3 of the time)

For example chess is completely solved by mathematical perspective and nobody can beat the most advanced bots(computers) today, because they play perfectly optimal.

Interesting subject though one thing is confusing to me. When he talks of evolutionary stable male to female ratio he said ideally you have 50/50. However in nature that doesn't seem to be the case all the time. Among lions you usually have one lion mating with numerous females, whales however exhibit the opposite behavior. One female may mate with several males in a season or choose only the strongest suitor of a group. This seems like polar opposites of the spectrum. In one situation a dominant male spreads his genetic material as much as possible over a wide array of females and there is only one mating male among many. On the other a female is outnumbered by males and may select either the strongest biggest suitor or in another species of whale will mate with all the prospective males making it impossible to know which is the father. Giving a chance to less powerful males to reproduce. In either case in whales during mating season you seem to have more males than females.

For all of the comments about evolution and the definition of theory, let me explain:
Fact: Verifiably accurate data.
Law: Statement which is always true under specific circumstances
Hypothesis: Testable, potentially falsifiable explanation of facts and laws
Theory: Unifying framework explaining all of the above.

A theory is better than a fact or a law. Get over it. A theory in science is not the same as a theory on your favorite TV show.
